builder.name: Colne Marine and Yacht Co. Ltd.

boat.construction_details: Carvel larch on Canandian rock elm with oak stem and stern

for_sales.sales_text:
PATIENT GRISELDA is a 25-foot gaff cutter, designed by Francis Jones and originally built for journalist and writer John Lewis. She is a traditional wooden yacht with classic lines, offering an exciting project for the right buyer.

General Condition

The yacht has been neglected for some time but appears to have benefited from significant investment in the past. The deck areas, superstructure, and cockpit seem structurally sound but are in need of cleaning and painting. Internally, the vessel was found to be surprisingly tidy, though damp and dirty.

Accommodation

  • Central saloon and living area
  • Small galley (basin missing)
  • Two settee berths (cushions in fair condition, though the starboard cushion was wet)
  • Small navigation area
  • Forward fo’c’sle area fitted for storage and workshop space
  • “Porta Potti” toilet facilities
  • Traditional painted and varnished timber finishes, generally attractive

Rigging & Sails

PATIENT GRISELDA is fitted with a gaff cutter rig, including:

  • Timber mast (possibly pitch pine, not confirmed)
  • Boom, bowsprit, and whisker pole
  • Galvanised steel wire standing rigging and guard wires (secure at the time of inspection)
  • Weathered and dirty running rigging

Sails:

  • Jib – Canvas, ochre in colour, well-used
  • Staysail – Dacron, tan bark in colour, well-used
  • Mainsail – Canvas, ochre in colour, weathered and aged, stowed on the boom
  • Mainsail cover – Serviceable

Equipment (All in Unknown Condition)

  • Engine: Lister SR2 air-cooled diesel engine (turns over freely with crank handle and decompression levers, visually tidy)
  • Cooking: Origo 3000 two-burner alcohol cooker with pan clamps
  • Navigation & Communication:
  • Standard Horizon GX13000E DSC VHF radio
  • Cobra HH350 handheld VHF radio
  • Plastimo Contest bulkhead-mounted steering compass (cockpit)
  • Garmin GPS 120XL receiver
  • Safety Equipment:
  • Fast Find Personal Locator Beacon (PLB) – Expired 2021
  • Safe Link Solo PLB – Expired 2020
  • Anchoring & Mooring:
  • Traditional manual anchor windlass
  • Plough-style anchor stowed on deck

Conclusion

PATIENT GRISELDA requires a thorough refit, but the hull is likely sound. She is a charming, classic yacht that, with care and restoration, could provide great enjoyment to the right owner. She is lying on a mooring in the River Dart, and must be removed from the harbour on purchase.

boat.full_description: Patient Griselda was originally built for journalist and writer John Lewis. She is a traditional wooden yacht with classic lines. While based in Southwold her owner gave her a curved "Dutch Style" gaff, which is shorter than a traditional English one.
boat.name: Patient Griselda
boat.short_description: A traditional wooden yacht with classic lines
